Intervention: Gemcitabine: 2500 milligrams per square metre (mg/m2), intravenously (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles.
Paclitaxel: 150 mg/m2, IV, every 14 days x 8 cycles
Gemcitabine: 2500 milligrams per square metre (mg/m2), intravenously (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles.
Carboplatin: Area under curve (AUC) 2.5, IV, every 14 days x 8 cycles
Eligibility: Women with a proven histological or cytological diagnosis of breast cancer
• Performance status of 0 or 1 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) scale
Patients were expected to have already received anthracycline-based treatments in the form of adjuvant or neo-adjuvant chemotherapy, and then progressed and developed metastatic disease.
Prior radiation therapy is permitted but must not have included whole-basin radiation.
• Serious concurrent disorders that would compromise the patient's safety or compromise the patient's ability to complete the study, at the discretion of the investigator
Concomitant administration of any other tumour therapy, including cytotoxic chemotherapy, hormone therapy and immunotherapy (including trastuzumab (Herceptin))
· Peripheral neuropathy of Common Toxicity Criteria (CTC) Grade greater than 1. History of significant neurological or mental disorders, including seizures or dementia
Results: Complete response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial response=30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive illness=20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; Stable illness=small changes that do not meet the above criteria.

Time: start of progressive disease measured (student tumour assessments were performed every 4 cycles during study treatment, or 3 months after treatment until disease progression, death or up to 24 months after randomization)
Description of the arm/group: Gemcitabine: 2500 milligrams per square metre (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles.
Paclitaxel: 150 mg/m2, IV, every 14 days x 8 cycles
Unit of Measure: Participants Complete Response (CR): 1
Description of the arm/group: Gemcitabine: 2500 milligrams per square metre (mg/m2), intravenous (IV), every 14 days x 8 cycles.
Carboplatin: Area under curve (AUC) 2.5, IV, every 14 days x 8 cycles
Unit of Measure: Participants Complete Response (CR): 0
